title: Yet another Boeing plane has a problem
text:
Frankfurt, Germany (CNN Business) Boeing got another dose of bad news Tuesday, as it announced its 777X plane, which is still under development, failed a safety test.

No one was injured in the test, which took place Friday. It entailed bending the wings of the plane while it was parked on the ground. Boeing said the test bent the wings "to a level far beyond anything expected in commercial service," and that the problem occurred 99% of the way through the test.

But during the test, the rear part of the fuselage depressurized, according to the Boeing statement. A person familiar with the test said one of the doors came off the plane. The company said it is now examining the test results to determine the cause of that problem.

Boeing BA Shares offell from their high of the day on news of the failed test, but shares ended 3% higher, showing investors were not shaken by the report.

General Electric GE The plane is not yet in service, and its debut had already been pushed back because of problems with a newengine, the GE9X , the world's largest commercial jet engine. Boeing said it doesn't believe the failed test "will have a significant impact on aircraft design or on our overall test program schedule."

Read More
description: Boeing got another dose of bad news Tuesday, as it announced its 777X plane, which is still under development, failed a safety test.
